com.bigdata.rdf.sparql.ast.cache

Interface IDescribeCache

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DescribeCache

    public interface IDescribeCache
    A maintained cache for the DESCRIBE of RDF resources.
    Author:
    Bryan Thompson TODO When has partitioned, each NSS instance (or DESCRIBE cache partition) should directly handle the describe of IVs that are directed to that partition.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void destroy()
      Destroy the cache.
      void insert(IV<?,?> iv, org.openrdf.model.Graph g)
      Insert/update the cache entry for an IV.
      void invalidate(Set<IV<?,?>> ivs)
      Invalidate the identified cache entries.
      org.openrdf.model.Graph lookup(IV<?,?> iv)
      Lookup and return the cache entry.

    • Method Detail

      • destroy

        void destroy()
        Destroy the cache.

      • invalidate

        void invalidate(Set<IV<?,?>> ivs)
        Invalidate the identified cache entries.
        Parameters:
        ivs - The IVs for the cache entries to be invalidated.

      • lookup

        org.openrdf.model.Graph lookup(IV<?,?> iv)
        Lookup and return the cache entry.
        Parameters:
        iv - The IV.
        Returns:
        The cache entry -or- null if there is no entry for that IV. TODO Vector lookups for query. We will need to use that to support a star-join against the DESCRIBE cache (leveraging materialized joins). TODO Offer a stream oriented response. For a single Graph , that could be a GraphQueryResult. For vectored lookups, this might be a stream of binding sets (vectored lookups make sense primarily in star joins, so this would really be the signature for the star-join operator).

      • insert

        void insert(IV<?,?> iv,
            org.openrdf.model.Graph g)
        Insert/update the cache entry for an IV.
        Parameters:
        iv - The IV.
        g - The Graph that describes that IV. TODO Vector inserts. TODO We probably need to include the timestamp of the database view from which the resource description was constructed.
